data.title: Guides and Forms
data.meta_description: Visit Leegov.com to find useful information for residents, businesses and visitors of Lee County in Southwest Florida
data.text:
Effective August 1, 2022 a fully executed Easement and Encumbrances Disclosure and Acknowledgment document will be required in addition to every fence permit application. The document, which is REQUIRED to be signed by the property owner, ensures that the property owner is aware that a fence placed in an easement (whether placed intentionally with the consent of the easement holder or unintentionally) must be removed at the expense of the property owner when requested by the easement holder.

Please email staff if you have any questions on this requirement.

May 16, 2021: New record type (OPN) - Exterior Openings (Windows/Shutters/Doors). More information.

​April 19, 2021: The Lee County Department of Community Development (DCD) is transitioning to a fully electronic submittal process beginning April 19 for building permit, zoning, planning and development review applications. Contractors, design professionals and agents will be required to submit applications and supporting documents through the DCD Public Portal, which is calledeConnect. Any paper submittals received before April 19 will remain a paper process through issuance and/or approval. eConnect training is available.

General: ​The Permitting department will no longer require the Building Addendum form, for any application.

General: The Design Professional Digital Signature Affidavit will no longer be required for digital signatures purchased through a 3rd party (i.e. CoSign, Verisign, DigiCert, etc.).

December 31, 2020: Building permit applications must comply with the Florida Building Code 7th Edition (2020) and master plans on file with the Department of Community Development must be certified as meeting this Code. For additional information, go to www.floridabuilding.org.

March 25, 2019: The Fort Myers Beach Fire Department's Life Safety Division assumed the duties of all fire plan review services for properties located within the Town of Fort Myers Beach. Call 239-590-4210 or email Prevention@FMBFire.org for additional information.
